data.title: Begin assetbrowser cleanup
data.body:
This builds on the changes in #3305 to generate the asset browser list from the package contents.
#3305 needs to be merged and this rebased before merging.

Additionally, be3b180 adds the xcc global mix database - we should obtain permission to ship that first too.

data.title: Asset Browser: Don't dump exported/converted files into the user dir
data.body: They should go into ^/AssetBrowser/<mod>/ or similar.

data.title: Migrate to SDL 2
data.body:
SDL 2 now has a stable ABI, and offers a bunch of improvements over 1.2.

The biggest immediate win is the SDL_WINDOW_FULLSCREEN_DESKTOP flag, which should (assuming it works correctly) let us throw out the horrendous launcher hack that we need to support pseudo-fullscreen on OSX.

https://github.com/flibitijibibo/SDL2-CS is a wrapper we could use.

data.title: AI taking over a player's game if he pauses the game
data.body:
I had an idea after that _JOo_ said on IRC : 

[22:39:07] omg ... klaas about 20 minutes afk ingame ...
[22:39:18]  i thought imma gonna shoot myself

What about adding an option that would let the AI take over a player's game if he pauses his game ?

The AI would play instead of the player if for some reason, he goes away..

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/338997-ai-taking-over-a-player-s-game-if-he-pauses-the-game?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: applies several visual tweaks
data.body:
full changelog:
- 2nd frame of Yak shp no longer uses greyscale instead of remap for the tail fins.
- Mobile Gap Generator finally has a shadow.
- Medium Tank barrel length increased by ~1-2 pixels (depends on angle).
- Light Tank barrel significantly downsized to match its low damage per shot.
- airfield now uses all 8 frames for flag anim and active anim.
- airfield house/tower empty pixels filled with shadow..
- Gap Generator now has some shadow.
- FRAG1 and FBALL1 explosions are now a bit more centered.
- wood crate received a shadow and was converted to the correct palette.
- silver crate now has a shadow, too.
- fixed some minor errors on Harisson's silo and added some shadow.
- Construction Yard got some shadow to better fit in line with other buildings.
- Pistol now uses single piff instead of multiple piffs.
- 50cal added to sequences.
- Light tank now uses 50cal instead of 120mm bullet.

data.title: Add force-move
validate building placement in ResolveOrder as well
new cnc map: deterring democracy (expansion of east vs. west)
PCX support for individual cameos
data.body: Basically, allow a cameo to have a specific palette, or allow it to be loaded as a .PCX file.

data.title: sniper should default with attackall or defend
data.body: New players do not understand the use of the sniper. Anything we can do to help this?

data.title: Debug : Detected exploit order from client 2 : StartProduction
data.body:
I was playing a 1vs1 game with Chaoticredux and he captured my MCV, then by Barracks and finally my Airstrip.

The game was not responding anymore, it didn't crashed but everything was strange, like frozen..

And when I clicked on the build palette (on the minigunner for example), I got this message :  Debug : Detected exploit order from client 2 : StartProduction

It seems that for some reason my build palette was still hooked up to the captured building.

data.title: Fix TS/RA2 mixfile performance
data.body: The CRC hashed filenames aren't added to the filesystem cache, so fetching contents from TS/RA2 mixes will always hit the slow path.

data.title: Parse XCC mix databases
data.body:
This adds support for reading mix content filenames from the XCC mix databases and adds IFolder.AllFileNames() for listing the contents of a package.

Local databases are embedded in any XCC (and from now, OpenRA) created mixfiles but we will need to ship the global database or ask modders to install it themselves.

Fixes #3301 and the backend of #3299.

data.title: Lobby map preview tooltips don't appear if the chatbox is focused
Ingame chat should default to team chat
Viceroids don't regenerate health while in a tiberium field
data.body: As far as I know, viceroids should regenerate health when in a tiberium field. I've tried placing them in both green and blue tiberium to no avail. Recreate by for example playing on the hourglass map which has a biological centre in the middle. Tested with the latest stable release (20130514).

data.title: Parse XCC local mix database from custom mix files (Asset Browser)
data.body:
XCC writes a custom filename lookup filename table into all the mixfiles it creates.
We should parse this to supplement the filename list returned by `IFolder.GetFilenames(Dictionary<uint, string> lookup)` (a new method proposed in #3299).

data.title: Annotate PackageContents yaml with palette information (Asset Browser)
data.body:
We should be able to define e.g. `b01.des:desert.pal` hinting the correct palette to use in the asset browser. Assets without hints should fall back to a default specified in the mod yaml somewhere (mod.yaml if there's no better alternative).

This will allow us to remove the hardcoded d2k/ra palette hack from AssetBrowserLogic.cs and more easily support theater assets and ra2/ts (which use a bunch of different palettes for units vs terrain vs UI).

data.title: View assets per-package (Asset Browser)
data.body:
It would be really nice if we could view the contents of individual packages (e.g mods/ra/bits / conquer.mix / caffeinated.oramap).

This may require a new method on IFolder - GetFilenames(Dictionary<uint, string> lookup) to resolve hashes to filenames (generated from the PackageContents yaml and/or the XCC global mix database) for resolving mixfile contents.

The file list should (if it doesn't already) display all the files, and display [no viewer] or similar for non-shp files. We can then work on additional file support (e.g. .yaml, .tmp, .vxl) as required.

data.title: Remove mod dll dependency on OpenRA.Utility.
data.body: Introduced by #3192. The functionality that it needs should be moved upstream into either Game or FileFormats.

data.title: Ai could build shipyard long away in converge
data.body:
In the map converge, the AI built a shipyard in the middle, when the base was far away.
I think it was the Hard AI

data.title: Remove Asset Browser from the main menu

milestone.title: June 2013 Playtest
milestone.description: Things that need testing first because they could jeopardize a stable release.

data.body: This is a feature that only a small subset of modders need and so displaying it prominently on the main menu is a disaster in terms of presenting a polished game. It should be moved into a ra-dev mod.

data.title: adding ImpactSounds to many weapons + other changes
data.body:
When I recently watched the new desert shellmap, I felt something was missing somehow. I soon realised there where sounds of guns firing and missiles launching, but barely any noticable explosion sounds. Not surprising, considering most weapons had no ImpactSound defined at all.
In addition, I felt not just the impact sound, but also the explosion animation of artillery and cruiser grenades was too unimpressive.

With these changes, most weapons using visible projectiles gain an impact sound, while artillery shells use the larger art-exp1 and use kaboom22 as impact sound.

data.title: Set the OrderLatency to 1 in single player games
data.body: Solves #2990 in a much simpler and robust way.

data.title: Tiberian Dawn ProximityCapturable
data.body: Fixes #2951 and #3290.

data.title: Adjusting infantry run animations to speed
data.body: I noticed that by default the run and prone-run animations are way too fast for the infantry movement speed. I used Tick values to fix this, taking into account individual speed. I used Tick: 80 for Speed: 5, 100 for speed 4 and 120 for speed 3. Some fine-tuning may be needed, but it already looks much better than before.

data.title: Can't capture hospitals anymore
data.body: I introduced range healing hospitals upon capture in C&C. Someone broke it.

data.title: Potato fields remap neutral player color
data.body: I fixed this a while ago. Someone introduced this as a regression.

data.title: Units stop whenever they get a new move order
data.body:
The more you click, the slower the unit will search for a new path and adjust it's course.

"Get away. HURRY!" _click_ _click_ _click_ - "Unit lost." - "FFS!"
